entry.title: Re: End-to-end Testing using Peppol Exchange in SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, Cloud Edition
entry.content:
@Yannik1 - I ran into this same phone & email issue on initial testing.  I edited the node 105651 in Manage Your Solution (or CBC) to include both the Phone and Email with valid values in the Address > Communication section in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, extended edition .  Below is error code I saw

Peppol (German requirements) mandate that you include both a phone and an email, along with an address.  You need to go to that node 105651 Edit Address for Company Codes. Select the Company and Address button.  Then make sure the phone, email and address data is complete in the Address > Communications section. I also had a fatal error on missing payment terms which sit on BP/customer.  On Payable side, if you're receiving an invoice, the Supplier would need to include their phone and email fields too. Or they can't send a Peppol invoices to Accounts Payable or in our case, Concur Invoice, if there is no phone or email specified.

entry.title: SAP Developer News September 4th, 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION

PODCAST: https://podcast.opensap.info/sap-developers/2025/09/04/sap-developer-news-september-4th-2025/↗

SAP Build introduces new MCP Servers

  • SAP Build introduces new MCP Servers to enable agentic development for Enterprise Applications: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-build-introduces-new-mcp-servers-to-enable-agentic-development-for/ba-p/14205602
  • Introducing the MCP Server for CAP: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/boost-your-cap-development-with-ai-introducing-the-mcp-server-for-cap/ba-p/14202849
  • First Release of the SAP Fiori MCP Server for Agentic AI Workflows: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-fiori-tools-update-first-release-of-the-sap-fiori-mcp-server-for/ba-p/14204694
  • Introducing the UI5 MCP Server: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/give-your-ai-agent-some-tools-introducing-the-ui5-mcp-server/ba-p/14200825
  • AI agents talk at SIT Porto: https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7358844307413393408/

ABAP Partner Reference Application

  • ABAP Partner Reference Application: https://github.com/SAP-samples/abap-partner-reference-application?tab=readme-ov-file

Step-by-step guidance to extend Joule via Joule Studio in SAP Build (Live Session)

  • Step-by-step guidance to extend Joule via Joule Studio in SAP Build (Live Session): https://learning.sap.com/live-sessions/step-by-step-guidance-to-extend-joule-via-joule-studio-in-sap-build

 

CHAPTER TITLES

0:00 Intro

0:10 SAP Build introduces new MCP Servers

2:28 Step-by-step guidance to extend Joule via Joule Studio in SAP Build (Live Session)

3:06 ABAP Partner Reference Application

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for September 4th, 2025.

[Witalij] If you see me wearing this T-shirt, you can be sure it's about AI. And you are absolutely right. This announcement has been wildly shared this week, but in case you missed it, we at SAP have introduced MCP servers to bring the Model Context Protocol into enterprise application development. The emerging open standard Mobile Context Protocol defines how large-language models can access tools and project context in a secure and structured way. Three servers are now available. For the Cloud Application Programming Model, for SAP Fiori Elements, and for SAPUI5. Let's double-click on each of them. The CAPMCP server has been released as open source under the Apache 2.0 license. It provides two tools for AI-assisted development of CAP applications, one to search across the compiled CDS model and one to search the CAP documentation. The Fiori MCP server lets AI agents generate and edit Fiori applications, discover apps in the workspace, and follow built-in rules that enforce best practices. This speeds up prototyping and makes iterations easier. The server is actually available as an experimental release. The UI5 MCP server equips your AI agents with six tools. This range from best practice guidelines and product scaffolding to searching the API reference, linking code and fixing deprecated APIs, providing insights into the project details. By releasing the CUP server as open source and extending MCP to Fiori and UI5, we are building an ecosystem where AI agents can actively support enterprise development. To learn more, we invite you to explore the CAP MCP server on GitHub, try out the UI5 and Fiori Elements servers in your own projects, and share your feedback on SAP community. And be sure to follow upcoming updates in SAP Build Code to see how Joule continues to expand MCP-based scenarios. By the way, if you are interested in AI agents, this month I will be presenting this very topic at SAP Meetup in Luz, in Poland, and at SAP Insight Track in Porto, Portugal. See you then.

[Nora] I have some great news for our listeners with a Learning Hub subscription, because the AI advocacy team is hosting a live session called Step-by-Step Guidance to Extend Joule by Joule Studio in SAP Build. It's going to take place on the 16th of September at 11 Central European Summertime, 11 a.m. It's targeted at developers. It's going to be a hands-on session that will teach you everything you need to know about Joule Studio, how to build your custom skills, how to integrate it into other systems, and how to test and deploy your skill. And it's targeted at beginners. So make sure you sign up and learn from the experts themselves.

[M K, Sheena] By leveraging the SAP BTP ABAP environment and the ABAP RESTful Application Programming model, you can build applications side-by-side to SAP solutions such as SAP S/4HANA Cloud. This GitHub repository provides a sample partner reference application called Music Festival Manager to build, deploy, and run side-by-side multi-tenant applications based on the SAP EVTP APAC Cloud to extend and integrate with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. These applications ensure SAP standards for enterprise-grade business solutions and also offers a consistent, harmonized user experience. The advantages include a clean code for a page safety, a scalable cloud development model, and secure integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud. In addition to the step-by-step tutorial, it also includes sizing guides, build materials, best practices, and tools for building multi-tenant extensions. Check out the GitHub repository link in the description box below and start building your enterprise create SaaS applications today.

entry.title: SAP UI5 Illustrations: Enhancing UX with Purposeful Visuals
entry.content:
What Are SAP UI5 Illustrations?

SAP UI5 illustrations are visual elements that complement written messages in the user interface. They’re not just decorative—they’re purposeful, designed to:

  • Simplify complex concepts
  • Create emotional connection
  • Guide users through unfamiliar workflows
  • Add personality to otherwise sterile enterprise screens

These illustrations are typically paired with messages in empty states, onboarding flows, error pages, or help dialogs. Think of them as visual metaphors that make abstract ideas more relatable.

Why Are They Necessary?

Here’s why illustrations are more than just eye candy in SAP UI5:

1. Improved Comprehension

Visuals help users grasp concepts faster than text alone. For example, an illustration of a magnifying glass next to a “No results found” message instantly conveys the idea of search failure.

2. Emotional Engagement

Enterprise apps can feel impersonal. Illustrations add warmth and friendliness, making users feel more comfortable and confident—even when something goes wrong.

3. Consistency Across SAP Fiori Design

SAP UI5 illustrations follow the SAP Fiori Guidelines ensuring a consistent look and feel across apps. This consistency builds trust and reduces cognitive load.

4. Accessibility and Inclusivity

Illustrations can support users with different language proficiencies or cognitive styles. When paired with clear text, they make the interface more inclusive.

5. Guided User Journeys

In onboarding or help flows, illustrations act as visual signposts. They guide users step-by-step, reducing friction and improving adoption.

Common Misuses to Avoid

SAP’s guidelines emphasize that illustrations should never:

  • Be used purely for decoration
  • Obstruct the user’s path
  • Replace essential information

They should always support the message, not distract from it.

️How to Use Them in SAP UI5

SAP UI5 provides a set of predefined illustrations via the sap.f library. Developers can easily integrate them using controls like IllustratedMessage, which combines an image, title, and description in a clean layout.

Example usage:

<sap.f.IllustratedMessage
    illustrationType="sapIllus-NoData"
    title="No Data Available"
    description="Try adjusting your filters or check back later." />

UI5 API Reference for Illustration

https://ui5.sap.com/#/api/sap.m.Illustration 

Illustration Samples

https://ui5.sap.com/#/entity/sap.m.IllustratedMessage/sample/sap.m.sample.IllustratedMessageInPageTNT

entry.title: ERROR AT THE ACTIVATION OF IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT
entry.content:
Good Afternoon Dear SAP Team

I'm trying to activate and implementation project
I'm doing the steps of complete all the Fine-Tune and Integrate and Extend activities in this project. Then go to the Go-live tab and complete activity Merge Changes and Activate Solution Capabilities.
But the system doesn't let me to activate because an error came up saying "Activity Merge Changes cannot be changed manually"

So, please if it is possible to have your help to solve this

Thanks
SAP Consultant


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: ERROR AT THE ACTIVATION OF IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT
entry.content:
Dear customer,

I hope you are well. 

It seems you directly tried to close activities "Activate Solution Capabilities".

This is a designed system behavior that this activity cannot be changed manually.

To close this activity, you need open this activity and perform this activity. 

After the Change Project has been merged, this activity may be displayed, depending on the business configuration changes that have been made in the Change Project. This is a special activity that switches on the communication/integration capabilities of newly scoped components. It is required to complete this activity to activate some elements after the merge. After completing this activity, the status of the project will be changed to Activated. Without performing and closing this activity, the project will not be able to be closed. 

Have a great day!  

Best regards, 

Tiago 
SAP Technical Support

Community:

SAP Business ByDesign:
https://www.sap.com/community/topics/business-bydesign.html

SAP Cloud for Customer: 
https://www.sap.com/community/topics/cloud-for-customer.html

entry.title: Histroy crashing after model replacement
entry.content:
Hello,

We are having this issue with a history in SAP Analytics Cloud, i will describe it in bullets for better understanding:

  1. We developed a analytic model in sap datasphere in a space called QA
  2. Then we made a history in SAP Analytics Cloud that consumes that analytic model in QA, everything is working correctly.
  3. We made a package of the analytic model in QA and imported it into another space called PRD
  4. Then we try replacing the model of the SAP Analytics Cloud history from the model in the space QA to the new model in the space PRD, but when we do this, we get this error:

    And everything crashes, nothing loads, and the web jus collapse.

  5. We tried making a fresh history with nothing in it and consuming the new model in the space PRD and that works fine

  6.  We tried making a fresh history with nothing in it and consuming the new model in the space QA and then replace it with the PRD model and that worked fine too.

  7. We also try erasing the analytic model in prd and all its pipeline, and then make a fresh package and import it again, but it doesn't work.

Thank in advance for your suggestions.

entry.title: aATP Product Substitution based on Material and Plant
entry.content:
Looking for expert comments on aATP Product Substitution in the SAP S/4HANA 2021 system:

1. Assume that each plant (Plant 1, Plant 2, etc.) has Product A as the original material and Product B as its substitute. 

2. Now aATP should first check Plant 1 for the availability of Product A. If not available, it should continue checking sequentially through Plant 2, Plant 3, Plant 4, and Plant 5, all for Product A.

3. If a partial quantity of Product A is available in Plant 1, aATP should consider that quantity to confirm and then check the remaining quantity in Plant 2, and so on. It should continue checking all plants until the full requirement is fulfilled with Product A.

4. If Product A is not available in any of the five plants, aATP should then consider Product B as the substitute, starting from the plant where the order was created. It should check Plant 1 for Product B, followed by Plant 2, Plant 3, Plant 4, and Plant 5, in the same sequence.

I know there is BAPI available in 2023 and possible, looking for the way out in case of S4HANA 2021.

entry.title: Re: Size of backup catalog

Hi team,

 

Note that their is a separate backup catalog for SystemDB and for each tenant.

You can get the size and oldest entries by running the HANA_Backups_CatalogSize_1.00.90+_MDC sql script from the collection attached to KBA ##1969700 - SQL Statement Collection for SAP HANA on the systemDB

 

For the steps on cleaning up see the admin guide:

entry.title: SAP Field Service Management 2508: AI, Crew Enhancements, and Improved Auto-Scheduling
entry.content:
SAP Field Service Management 2508 advances AI-driven field service with smarter filtering, higher auto-scheduling limits, and more configurable insights. New crew capabilities (visualization, configuration, and auto-scheduling), map-based planning scenarios and quick views, plus mobile multi-select dropdowns and contextual UDFs, help teams plan faster and execute with confidence. In this blog, we’ll explore the most notable SAP FSM 2508 features, along with demo videos showcasing key highlights.

For the complete list of all features in the 2508 release, click here.

Key Highlights in SAP Field Service Management 2508

  • Crew Management – Improved visualization of crews on the dispatching board, auto-scheduling of crews, configurable crew types, and new screen configuration options for technician quick views.
  • Generative AI – Intelligent filtering now available in the activity and service call web apps, plus extended configuration options for generative AI insights.
  • Bulk Options on Activity List – Assign or unassign multiple activities at once, reducing repetitive clicks.
  • Auto-Scheduling Limits Extended – Support for up to 5,000 unique locations (vs. 3,000 previously) and 250 technicians or crews (vs. 100 previously).
  • Service Map – New support for planning scenarios, plus technician and activity quick views..
  • Mobile App – Multi-selection in dropdown lists, and access to UDFs of related objects directly on mobile.

Crew Management Enhancements:

Visualize assignment timeframes of crew members:

Dispatchers can now see crew member availability directly on the dispatching board, with clear indicators if technicians are already assigned elsewhere. This gives planners more transparency and flexibility for complex crew jobs. More info here.

Auto-scheduling for crews:

Crews can now be included in auto-scheduling runs, removing the need for dispatchers to assign them manually. Using business rules and the Re-Optimization API, activities can be scheduled to entire crews or specific technicians, improving scheduling flexibility and efficiency across high-volume operations. See the documentation here.

Crew types

SAP FSM 2508 introduces structured crew types, making it easier to classify and activate generic or specialized dynamic crews for scenarios like emergency response, storms, etc. This improves master data control and clarifies crew purpose. Find out more about this update here.

Technician quick view configuration

Get the right data to the right people, instantly. With configurable Quick Views, dispatchers and crew leads see only what matters – IDs, qualifications, and UDFs tailored to their role. The result: faster crew management, fewer errors, and simplified workflows. Learn more here.

 

AI-Driven Field Service Management

Increased scheduling limits

Scale to meet the demands of high volume appointment-centric field service. 2508 raises scheduling limits to 5,000 unique locations and 250 technicians or crews, enabling field service organizations to handle high-volume appointment runs in a single task. Larger teams and more complex workloads can now be optimized at once – driving efficiency, SLA adherence, and faster response in the field. See the documentation here.

Intelligent filtering on activity and service call web apps

Dispatchers can now filter activities and service calls faster with intelligent natural language queries from the activity and service call web apps using all supported languages. Whether searching by priority, type, or custom translations, results update instantly – making it easier to locate critical jobs and boost dispatcher productivity. Read more here.

AI insights configuration enhancements

With this release, users can fine-tune which activities feed into Activity Summaries and Equipment Insights by execution stage i.e., closed, execution, cancelled, etc. This added control ensures insights stay focused on the most relevant work – providing more relevant and reliable AI insights tailored to specific use-cases. More information available here.

Note: The Activity Summary, Equipment Insights, and Natural Language Filtering features require customers to be licensed for SAP AI Units. For more information about licensing, please contact your SAP Account Executive.

User Experience & Usability Enhancements

Scheduling and Dispatching

Bulk actions to simplify workflows

Managing large volumes of activities is now simpler with an updated Activity List interface and expanded bulk actions. Dispatchers can quickly unassign, duplicate, or adjust multiple tasks at once – boosting productivity while reducing clicks. Learn more about this enhancement here.

Highlight dependencies directly on the planning board

Schedulers often juggle multiple jobs across the same customers and equipment, making it easy to miss critical links. With the new highlighting option, related activities are instantly surfaced on the planning board – helping dispatchers see dependencies at a glance, reduce scheduling errors, and keep connected work aligned. More information here.

Service Map

Service Map: Planning Scenarios

With planning scenarios now supported in the Service Map, dispatchers only see the jobs and technicians relevant to the scenario at hand. This eliminates unnecessary map clutter, improves focus, and ensures planners can work with the exact operational scope they need. Read more here.

Service Map: Activity quick view (ArcGIS Online)

Dispatchers often manage hundreds (or more) jobs on the map at once, making it difficult to quickly identify the right one. With the new activity quick view, dispatchers can simply hover over a job on the Service Map to see key details instantly – without extra clicks or drilling into the activity. Screen configuration also allows you to display custom fields, so only the most relevant information is shown. See more here.

Service Map: Technician quick view

Field service organizations need instant access to the right field information. With the technician quick view, hovering over a technician icon now reveals job title, availability status, and role-specific details. Custom fields ensure each dispatcher sees the information most relevant to their operation – streamlining planning and accelerating workforce decisions directly from the map. See the documentation here.

Mobile Field Service

Multi-select dropdowns in Smartforms

With new multi-select dropdowns in Smartforms, technicians can now select several options simultaneously – whether logging asset conditions, materials, or work outcomes – saving clicks and boosting efficiency in the field. Read more about this feature here.

 Access UDFs from related object

Mobile access to UDFs from related objects applies business logic so the right fields appear in context – for example, a return work type shows Return Reason instead of Warranty Reason – reducing errors and streamlining technician workflows. Learn more here.

 Final Thoughts:

SAP Field Service Management 2508 continues our push toward intelligent, connected field service. Expanded intelligent filtering, scaled auto-scheduling for high-volume, appointment-centric operations, and configurable AI insights bring faster, more reliable decisions to the front line.

On the ground, crews benefit from structured types, role-aware quick views, and automated scheduling; planners gain clearer crew visibility on the board and scenario-based focus on the Service Map. Technicians move quicker on mobile with multi-select inputs and contextual UDFs that surface the right data at the right moment.

This release is another step toward simplifying and modernizing field service and driving operational excellence. We look forward to your feedback and ideas on how to keep pushing FSM forward, whether through Influence requests, the Community page, or upcoming webinars. Your input makes the difference.

Check out the other SAP Field Service Management releases below:

  • SAP Field Service Management 2505
  • SAP Field Service Management 2502
  • SAP Field Service Management 2411
  • SAP Field Service Management 2408
  • SAP Field Service Management 2405
  • SAP Field Service Management 2402

entry.title: Re: スーパー管理者であるS-Userの削除について
entry.content:
「重要な職能を割当られているため、削除できません」というメッセージが表示され、削除できません

--->それは該当S-usersはPartner Contactロールを持っているから、削除されないです。

 

本事象を解決するため、以下の二つの方法がありますので、ご参考いただければと思います。

１．KBA 1271517 - Important Contact descriptions and how to view/change S-users with important functions - SAP for Meを確認ください。

該当内容を抜粋致します、ご確認するようにお願い申し上げます。

Partner Contact

Partner Contact/User (PRM_CP) is a role maintained by the customer's Partner Security Manager within the SAP Partner Portal and allows S-users to access the partner portal. 

If you need to update the Partner Security Manager (PRM_SMGR), please contact partner support using the "Get Support" on the partner "Get assistance" dashboard.

To add/remove partner roles and authorizations for S-user IDs, the company's Partner Security Manager (S-user) must make the changes in the SAP Partner Portal according to KBA 2609123. Or, contact partner support using the partner Get Help page or contact SAP Partner Support using the "Get Support" on the partner "Get assistance" dashboard.
DO NOT create a case for XX-SER-FORME for partner authorizations/roles.

つまり、Partner Support Teamに連絡して、Partner Contactロールを該当S-usersから削除されると、S-usersを削除できます。

 

２．2025/10/1でSAPを連絡して、SAP側は該当S-usersを直接削除します。

entry.title: Re: SAP Datasphere - Architecture and Lessons-Learned
entry.content:
@MKreitlein Thank you for the super useful contribution! I wonder if the product owners will incorporate some quality of life (QOL) improvements in future release cycles.

My first client in 2021 was on the initial Data Warehouse Cloud platform and most of our objects were in 1 space. It became cluttered very quickly. Also, integration with SAC via a Consumption and Perspective was interesting 😅

Some quick thoughts on "the bad" list ...

  1. Applying the Data Access Control on the Analytical model makes a lot of sense since it would allow the singular Fact model to be somewhat generic while apply the security to the tailored business-focused objects. I haven't run into the scenario of multiple, identical fact views due to DAC requirements but will keep this in mind. Very helpful.
  2. You're right about dependencies! I normally activate the analytical models out of habit (and sometimes need to use Dependency Analysis for popular objects). A popup or warning message would greatly help in these scenarios.
  3. I haven't ran into that issue with folders. I've deployed multiple views, fact models, and analytical models and they have remained in my folders. Are you referring to shared objects?
  4. Funny enough I warned an "architect" about that issue but I don't think he understood the impact. Fast forward to today and the client's production system has a Q-prefix 😅

I greatly enjoyed learning about your experience. Hopefully this conversation encourages others to chime in. 👍

entry.title: SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA – Adding a GUI transaction to the launchpad in SAP S/4HANA 2023 or higher
entry.content:
TL;DR: Yes, you can add your custom GUI transactions (aka "Z transactions") to the SAP Fiori launchpad.

  1. Quickly understand the concept of adding launchpad content in learning video: Bringing Apps Onto SAP Fiori Launchpad for SAP S/4HANA Cloud and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition [05:25]
  2. Your most important step is to create the Launchpad App Descriptor Item using the tool Launchpad App Manager.
  3. Your most important decision for each LADI is deciding which Semantic Object to assign to the transaction, as the Semantic Object drives intent-based navigation across the launchpad, i.e. where the tile or link to the transaction will appear in app-to-app navigation.

Screenshots in this blog post are from a Cloud Appliance Trial system SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS03.

Why you might need to add a GUI transaction to the SAP Fiori launchpad

Often system conversion customers have created several custom (aka “Z”) transactions in SAP ECC that they intend to continue using in SAP S/4HANA. They need to bring these custom transactions into the SAP Fiori launchpad to create a unified user experience across new SAP Fiori apps and classic UIs (including SAP GUI transactions).

While SAP provides launchpad content entries for most of the SAP delivered transactions, you may occasionally find a transaction that has been missed or excluded, and you can add your own entry. For example, an administration transaction for an industry solution.

Recommendation: If you have many custom transactions to bring onto the Fiori launchpad, consider adding them over time starting with the highest usage to least usage. You can use transaction ST03N to determine the usage of your custom transactions.  

In this blog post you will find:

  • Steps to add a GUI transaction to the Fiori launchpad
  • Understanding Launchpad App Descriptor Items for GUI transactions
  • How to create a Launchpad App Descriptor Item for a GUI transaction
  • Improve Navigation with Parameters

Steps to add a GUI transaction to the Fiori launchpad

  1. Your most important step is to create the Launchpad App Descriptor Item (LADI) using the tool Launchpad App Manager.  A LADI literally describes an app that can be launched from the Fiori launchpad. This includes which app needs to be launched, what parameters may be passed when the app is launched, and the tile or link that the user selects to launch the app.  The LADI covers launching the app either directly from a page or indirectly from another app.
    • Your most important decision when creating the LADI is deciding which Semantic Object to assign to the transaction, as the Semantic Object drives intent-based navigation across the launchpad, i.e. where the tile or link to the transaction will appear. You maximize use of SAP predefined Semantic Objects to make the most of the navigation benefits.
    • Make sure you provide a user-meaningful tile title and link title.   This will help your users recognize and find the transaction.
    • It’s a good idea to include the transaction code (aka tcode) as a tile keyword for Search on Apps.  This helps users who are transitioning from SAP GUI to SAP Fiori and already know their tcodes. 
    • You can optionally add parameters to be passed to the transaction when it is launched.

 

  1. Once the LADI has been created you can assign it to users in the same manner as predefined content provided by SAP.   For example, you:
    • Reference your custom transaction LADI to one or more business catalogs using the tool Launchpad Content Manager.
    • Update the business catalog assignment to the user’s business roles using the Role Maintenance transaction PFCG or program PRGN_COMPARE_ROLE_MENU.  If needed, you can also adjust data authorizations for the role.
    • Optionally add a tile for your LADI on pages using the SAP Fiori app F4512 Manage Launchpad Pages. 

IMPORTANT: You can come back and change the entry any time in the Launchpad App Manager. Changes are automatically and immediately (caching permitting) reflected wherever the LADI is used. 

Hint: You can find which spaces and pages are assigned to your business role using the tool Launchpad Content Manager. Navigate to tab Catalogs. Find and select your business catalog.  In pane Content in Catalog, select the LADI (i.e. tile/TM) and then Display Usages in Pages.

References:

  • SAP Help: SAP Fiori Launchpad – Administration Guide - Creating and Maintaining Launchpad App Descriptor Items and especially subsection Creating Transaction Codes
  • SAP Help – SAP Fiori launchpad – Administration Guide – Setting up Launchpad Content - Best Practices and Typical Scenarios for Setting Up Launchpad Content - Best Practices for Managing Catalogs

Understanding Launchpad App Descriptor Items for transactions

If you are new to creating LADI’s, it's a good idea to start by reviewing a LADI for a predefined transaction to understand what details are required and to familiarize yourself with the tooling.

Open the tool Launchpad App Manager. 

You can use the tile on the Fiori Launchpad space assigned to the Fiori Foundation Administration role. This role is generated by task list SAP_FIORI_FOUNDATION_S4 with the default id Z_FIORI_FOUNDATION_ADMIN.

Fiori Launchpad page highlighting the tile Launchpad App Manager

 

Navigate to the tab Transaction Code and search for a transaction code.

On the tab Transaction Code, searching for transaction VA01, 3 results are listed

 

Hint: There can be more than one entry if the transaction is used in different use cases with different parameters for different navigational needs. For example, transaction VA01 has some parallel uses for Industry Oil and Gas. Notice that each LADI has a different SemanticObject-Action combination.

Select the link on the technical catalog id to see the details.

Technical catalog id is the first column of the tab Transaction Code. Select the hyperlink on the technical catalog id to view the catalog.

Take a careful note of the assigned Semantic Object.  Arguably the most important field when creating the Launchpad App Descriptor Item is the Semantic Object, as the Semantic Object controls where the navigation links to the GUI transaction appears. For example, in:

  • Related Apps buttons
  • List of links dialogs
  • List of links on process/document flow cards
  • Related apps in Search Results

For some examples of these, refer to my earlier post SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA – Pro-tips for demonstrating SAP Fiori – Navigate with confidence.

You will also notice that most GUI transactions are marked as not suitable for use on device type = Phone.

IMPORTANT: If you do need to make a SAP GUI transaction available on smartphone, you should consider using SAP Screen Personas to add a mobile layout to the transaction, e.g. using the Slipstream Engine as explained in  blog post Choosing Slipstream Engine or SAP GUI for HTML to render SAP Screen Personas flavors on mobile devices

LADI for transaction VA01 is shown highlighting the Semantic Object SalesDocument. Device Type settings are Desktop enabled, Tablet enabled, Phone disabled.

On the Tiles tab you can see details of the tiles and any keywords

Tiles tab of the LADI shows the tile type (static), tile title, subtitle, keywords, icons, etc.

The Parameters tab lists parameters that may be passed to the transaction when it is launched.

Passing parameters is optional.  Only GUI transactions have Parameters defined as in the example below for transaction FB60. You can see a user Default Value  TaxIsCalculatedAutomatically is passed, and the current supplier id is passed to the field INVFO-ACCNT. The Rename To field is the technical name of the GUI transaction field where the value will be passed.  If no value is maintained in Rename To the value is passed to the field of the same name as the Parameter itself.

Hints:

  • You can usually only pass parameters to the initial screen of a SAP GUI transaction. This is a restriction of SAP GUI.
  • Which parameters are passed depends on the context, i.e. where and how the app was launched.  For example, when the app is launched from a tile, default values are passed. When an app is launched from another app, values in the current context of the app can be passed.

Parameters tab of the LADI shows 2 parameters may be passed, a Default Value and/or the Supplier.

How to create a Launchpad App Descriptor Item for a GUI transaction

Open the tool Launchpad App Manager.

Navigate to the tab Technical Catalogs.

You can add your LADI to an existing custom technical catalog, or you can create a new technical catalog of type standard catalog. Technical catalogs are essentially lists of available app descriptors to use on the launchpad, so they can hold many LADIs. It’s common practice to have one technical catalog per functional area or sub-functional area. You might have some additional technical catalogs for common “every user” apps, administration/support apps, etc.

Hint: A standard catalog can hold any combination of UI content.

To create a new technical catalog, you select the New Standard Catalog button.

Launchpad App Manager showing the Technical Catalogs tab. The button New Standard Catalog is highlighted and appears in the table toolbar.

Give your catalog an id and a title. The recommended naming convention for technical catalogs is Z_TC_xxxxx.  Make sure the title is human readable so that you can find it again later.

Assign transport details when asked, i.e. package and workbench request.

 

Technical catalog id follows the naming convention Z_TC_xxxx. The technical catalog title is user-meaningful. Package and transport request have been entered. The Create Empty Technical Catalog Only flag is checked.

 

Once you have found or created your technical catalog, select the technical catalog id to open it.

On the tab Technical Catalogs, the hyperlink on the technical catalog id Z_TC_ADMIN_APPS is highlighted.

Select menu button Add App then Add Transaction

The technical catalog Z_TC_ADMIN_APPS is opened in Edit mode. The toolbar menu button Add App is open. The sub option Add Transaction are highlighed.

 

Add transport details for the LADI entry, i.e. package and workbench request.  Make sure you use the same package as the technical catalog. 

In the dialog Select Transport Request, the Package and Transport Request are entered.

 

Enter transaction and press the <ENTER> key.

Several of the LADI fields will be defaulted. For example: Device Type, Application Component, and Tile title. These defaults are derived from the SAP GUI transaction definition which you can view in transaction SE93.  In the example below you can see the defaults for the configuration transaction /UI2/FLP_CUS_CONF. You can overwrite these defaults if you wish.

Hint: The application component is primarily useful for support. It will be shown when the user selects the About information or App Support in the User Menu.  Refer to SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA – New improvements in App Support

Details of the LADI are shown highlighting fields updated on pressing <ENTER> including the device type checkboxes, the application component, and a Tile is created

 

In the tab Tiles, a tile has been created automatically. Within the tile definition, the tile title is derived from the transaction text in SE93.  The tile keyword is set to the transaction code by default, so that users can find the transaction by its tcode when using the search bar feature Search on Apps.  This is especially helpful for existing business users transitioning from SAP GUI to SAP Fiori, as these users typically know many of their tcodes already. 

An example of the tab Tiles showing the Tile Title and Tile Keyword fields

Select a suitable Semantic Object. You can search using the application component or by text. 

Recommendation: To maximize the benefits of intent-based navigation, use an existing SAP predefined Semantic Object. SAP delivers more than 3K semantic objects.   You can find the complete list in transaction /UI2/SEMOBJ_SAP.  For example, for a custom transaction related to Sales Orders using the Semantic Object SalesOrder or SalesDocument means your custom transaction will be automatically provided in app-to-app navigation features of other Sales Order apps.  For example, your custom transaction will appear as a link in Related Apps, list of links dialogs, search results etc. 

IMPORTANT:   Do NOT create Z versions of SAP Semantic Objects as this removes the benefit of intent-based navigation.  For example, do NOT create a Semantic Object called ZSalesOrder - as this will not provide any app-to-app navigation links to other apps.  In the very rare case where you need to create a custom semantic object, you must create these in transaction /UI2/SEMOBJ before creating the LADI. 

Example of the value help dialog for Semantic Objects. You can search for semantic objects using the application component, or by keyword.

Add an action name as a verb in camelCase, e.g. editConfigurationParameters. You can freely define the action name.  

Hint: To clearly separate custom actions from SAP actions, some customers prefer to start custom actions with a "z".  e.g. zeditConfigurationParameters. 

Recommendation: The combination of SemanticObject-Action should be unique for each intent-based navigation use case.  

Example of the LADI tab Target Application Fields showing the Action field set to the custom action editConfigurationParameters

 

Add a link text in the field Target Application Title. The link text will be seen by the business user whenever a link is provided to navigate to the app, instead of a tile. For example, when navigating from Search results, from Related Apps, from list of links dialogs, etc.

Example of the LADI tab Target Application fields showing the Target Application Title field that holds the link text

Optionally on the Tiles tab you can add tile subtitle, information text, and icon.

Example of the LADI tab Tiles highlighting the Subtitle, Tile Information, Tile icon fields

You need to enter the icon name prefixed with sap-icon:// e.g. sap-icon://customize

Hint: You can use the value help on the tile icon field, or find available SAP icon names in the Icon Explorer. Author's note: Personally I find it easier to pick and choose my icon using the Icon Explorer where I can search for icons by keywords, compare similar icons, view how the icon appears, and review the tags to get some idea of its intended usage.

 

SAP Icon Explorer showing the resulting icons found when searching on the keyword "customize" and the sap-icon:// value of a selected icon in the Copy section

Once you are satisfied with your LADI details, Save your entry.

Your new Launchpad App Descriptor Item (LADI) is now ready for use.  For example: the LADI can be referenced in a business catalog, assigned via the business catalog to a business role, optionally added to a page, etc.

You can come back and change the entry any time in the Launchpad App Manager. Changes will be automatically and immediately reflected wherever the LADI is referenced.

Improve Navigation with Parameters

Parameters can be passed to your SAP GUI Transaction from the current context in SAP Fiori. For the user, passing relevant parameters reduces typing and avoids mistakes. You can pass:

  • Default Values on launch of the transaction
  • Context values from a source app during app-to-app navigation
  • Predefined defaults to a field or to the OK-Code

To pass a parameter to a SAP GUI transaction, the transaction must be able to accept it, such as fields on the initial entry screen of the transaction.

Hint: If you need to pass parameters to a subsequent screen of a transaction, consider using SAP Screen Personas scripting.

You will need to know the technical screen field name of the target field.  You can find this from the technical information in the context menu of the field as shown below.

Example of GUI transaction VA01 showing the context menu on field Order Type. The menu option Help (F1) is highlighted

 

Within the Field Help dialog, select the Technical Information button.

Example of the field help dialog. The technical information button is highlighted

 

Find the Dynpro Field in the section Field description for Batch Input. The Dynpro Field is the technical screen field name.

Example of the Technical Information dialog for field Order Type. The Dynpro field is highlighted in the section Field Description for Batch Input

 

You can also pass values to the Ok Code and – provided all mandatory fields on the initial screen are filled – you can pass a value to skip the initial screen. To pass a value to the OkCode, set your technical OkCode code as the static Default Value and Rename To = DYNP_OKCODE. To skip the first screen, set Default Value = 1 and Rename To = DYNP_NO1ST.

 

Example of Parameters for transaction VA02 highlighting the Rename To column. Values are also passed to DYNP_OKCODE and DYNP_NO1ST

 

Becoming a SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA guru

You’ll find much more on our  SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA topic page

Brought to you by the SAP S/4HANA RIG and Customer Care team

entry.title: ONB – Email Trigger on PDC Completion with custom MDF object field Condition
entry.content:
Hi,

We use the New Hire Template for Personal Data Collection with some custom MDF objects, and need to trigger custom emails upon completion of Personal Data Collection based on certain field values in these MDF objects.

Example: In one custom MDF object, if the new hire selects value x in field a, an email should trigger once PDC is complete. 

We set up custom categories, triggers, and a PostSave rule on the Process Object to check task completion and validate the field value in the custom MDF object (screenshot attached). However:

  • When the if condition on the custom MDF is removed, the email triggers correctly (but defeats the purpose as it triggers for everyone).

  • When the if condition on the custom MDF is added, the email only triggers if the start date is today or in the past (not useful, since hire dates are always in the future).

What’s the correct solution to ensure the email triggers as intended?

Business rule screenshot -

Regards,

Divia

entry.title: BiWhy – CMS DB Analysis
entry.content:
Disclaimer:

BiWhy was conceived as comprehensive support tool for SAP BusinessObjects (BOBJ) to troubleshoot issues and facilitate administrative tasks, but as about half of its functionality is not directly tied to BOBJ, it can be used to troubleshoot and monitor other products. That makes it a General-Purpose Support Tool, with the goal of including functionality most demanded by support engineers and software administrators.

BiWhy is currently available exclusively through CoE Max Attention Engagements.

 

What it is for:

  • Analyse CMS DB:
    • Understand your system usage.
    • Identify what is causing growth (count or size-wise).
    • See what is retained over time.
    • Analyze time trends.
  • Compare two snapshots to identify differences and common parts:
    • Between target and source systems to verify promotion.
    • For the same system to see what has changed.

When to run it:

  • Occasionally, to get an impression of what is happening in the system and for housekeeping purposes.
  • NB: Before migration or major promotions, it is a good idea to clean up the CMS DB to speed up promotion and reduce the number of failures.

Background

  • This functionality has already been used with more than 38 customers, in some cases repeatedly and across multiple systems.
  • The largest CMS DB processed contained 34 million objects.
  • CMS DB fetch is optimized with indexed fields, filters, self-tuning batch size, and incremental fetch options.

Analysis & Visualization with BiWhy Embedded Analytic Controls

  • Flexible table:
    • Show/hide columns
    • Group/aggregate
    • Regex filters for any column
    • Global and local statistics
    • Export to Excel
  • Set of charts
  • CMS DB tree:
    • Build by folders or parents
    • Choose how to view a node (show/hide any available field)
    • Sort by selected field
    • Search

 

Screenshots:

Table overview (grouped by kind, sorted by file size):

Just another table view – one of many:

Time-buckets chart:

Tree view:

entry.title: Re: SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA – Adding a GUI transaction to the launchpad in SAP S/4HANA 2023 or hig
entry.content:
Hi Community,

"

  • Your most important decision when creating the LADI is deciding which Semantic Object to assign to the transaction, as the Semantic Object drives intent-based navigation across the launchpad, i.e. where the tile or link to the transaction will appear. You maximize use of SAP predefined Semantic Objects to make the most of the navigation benefits.
  • Make sure you provide a user-meaningful tile title and link title.   This will help your users recognize and find the transaction.
  • It’s a good idea to include the transaction code (aka tcode) as a tile keyword for Search on Apps.  This helps users who are transitioning from SAP GUI to SAP Fiori and already know their tcodes. "

Thanks for your kindly sharing, 

it really help us a lot.

 

🙂

Regards,

ZFiori.

entry.title: Changing the batch number of Header Product in Manufacturing Order using BAPI for Exceptional Cases
entry.content:
Problem: Earlier it was not possible to change the Batch number assignment from Production or Process Order using BAPI. Customers had to develop custom program to change the batch number. For some of the customers it is mandatory or part of business process to  change batch number during Receiving if batch is inherited from S4 to EWM. (Unlike many EWM process)

Solution: SAP has released 2 notes.

3361111 - Create order via BAPI: Specify batch

3492667 - Changing batch of order header item via BAPI

With this note, it is possible to have following influence on Manufacturing Order( Production & Process Order)

  1. Blank the batch field using  BAPI_PRODORD_CHANGE for Production Order
  2. Blank the batch field using  BAPI_PROCORD_CHANGE for Process Order
  3. Change the batch field with new batch using BAPI_PRODORD_CHANGE for Production Orders
  4. Change the batch field with new batch using BAPI_PROCORD_CHANGE for Process Orders

In last 2 cases, Batch has to be create afront using MSC1N or BAPI_BATCH_CREATE as above bapi does have capability to create batches on the fly and swap/delete the assignment of Header Material.

Create and release a production with Batch assignment in S4

PMR is created( PMR never contains any batches neither for Header nor for components)

Create a new batch with BAPI_BATCH_CREATE

Trying to change the Batch in RF inherited from S4, EWM does not allows

Customer can build a custom 'Function Code' in RF which can directly create new and change the Batch in MO header using BAPI_BATCH_CREATE and BAPI_PRODORD_CHANGE. To classify the batches in S4, use FM MATERIAL_READ to query the product and change Batch attribute using FM VM_MAINTAIN_MHD if customer needs to update attribute in S4.( Else EWM during receiving updates DOM as current date, please have LOBM_HSDAT and LOBM_VFDAT mandatory in Batch class)

To change the batch, set the BATCH indicator in the ORDERDATAX structure and pass new batch number 0000000483. The system then takes the entry in the BATCH field into account when the BAPI is executed. The batch can also be deleted from the order header. For this, the field BATCH remains empty in the structure ORDERDATA, and the indicator BATCH is set in the structure ORDERDATAX

 

Check Order Now! New Batch is updated in Order Header. 

The header level changes are incorporated in production order admin tab

Now, Try receiving the MO 1000622 with RF. The new batch is updated in Process Order as well in EWM reads the new batch( Embedded EWM S4H 2022)

EWM allows to GR from RF with Batch change conducted via BAPI

Interesting to see how this works in Decentralized EWM on S4H

All test is performed in S4 HANA Embedded 2022 Sandbox system

entry.title: Count 14 consecutive days of clocked-in
entry.content:
Hello Experts!

Would you know if it is possible (and how) can we manage to count the number of consecutive days the employee has clocked in for work? We have a customer requirement to raise an Alert and Warning if the employee has clocked in for more than 14 days consecutively.

I tried to configure it but the count resets every week, since 14 days crosses two weeks.

I have an idea but not sure if this will work (week numbers are not necessarily the specific week of the month):

Week 1 - 3 consecutive days (count for container 1)

week 2 - 7 consecutive days (count for container2)

week 3 - 4 consecutive days (count for container3)

if employee clocks in on 5th day of 3rd week system should raise an alert..

Not sure if it is possible to verify consecutive weeks (containers as above).

entry.title: EWM/S4 inventory discrepancy
entry.content:
Dear Expert,

Recently I found there was an EWM/S4 inventory discrepancy in our SAP system. After checking, below is the transaction flow:

1.GR production order and inventory in IM location FG01. Suppose batch A00001, quantity 10.
2.A background job moved A00001 to EWM location 1040， an inbound delivery was created, suppose 18000001. However, the A00001 inventory remained in FG01.
3.Due to some error, a user posted a 102 transaction to return A00001 to the production order from FG01. The 102 transaction was posted successfully. Now, A00001 in FG01 is 0.
4.The user performed GR and put away for the inbound delivery 18000001.
5.The inbound delivery 18000001 was stuck in the queue due to a deficit of A00001 (10 quantity) in FG01.
6.Now, A00001 in 1040 is 0 but there is 10 quantity in the EWM monitor.

Could you please advise if there is a setting to check the FG01 inventory when doing GR in EWM? Thanks a lot.

entry.title: Differences between Normal and Adjustment Posting Periods in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I would like to clarify the differences among the posting periods in the Manage Posting Period app.

While testing how to configure posting periods to reverse entries from 2025/06, I noticed some confusing results. For all cases, I used the same settings across all account types.

Configuration 1
Normal period: 006.2025–009.2025
Adjustment period: none
Result: Able to reverse entries for 2025/06

Configuration 2
Normal period: 008.2025–009.2025
Adjustment period: none
Result: Unable to reverse entries for 2025/06

Configuration 3
Normal period: 008.2025–009.2025
Adjustment period: 013.2000–009.2030
Result: Able to reverse entries for 2025/06, and able to post AR for 2025/06

As far as I know, the Adjustment period should not impact AR/AP postings. However, based on the above tests, it seems to have an effect. Could someone explain the difference between the Normal period and the Adjustment period in this context?

Also, I have one more question: if Account Type V (Contract Accounts) does not have an account range defined, what is the purpose or function of this account type?

Thanks in advance for your help!

Elma

entry.title: Use Employment Differentiator for Translation Limitation on People Profile and Spotlight Header
entry.content:
From customer implementation, we observe that the language translation on the spotlight header would stay in default language English instead of the expected translation version (f.e. French) by Language switch via user Settings.  Know issue was reported by the SAP Note below.

2648773 - Position Title and Department and Division are shown in English on Employee Profile header - Employee Profile

First, the French Translation has maintained in the Globe context menu for the Position. From the screenshots below, after switch the user language to French,  the translation for these Job and Org fields are displayed properly in Full Spotlight "Organization" Category Card.  However, the same French translation could not be synced to the Spotlight Header or Full Profile Header part where they are still displayed in English.

Secondarily, these Organization and Job Information fields displayed on Spotlight and Header Areas are coded with no feasibility to customize. 

  

 

As a workaround, we could introduce to use Employment Differentiator.  This differentiators function provides flexibility to display defined or customized three fields from JobInfo for all users no matter whether the user has multiple employments or not. You don't need to have prerequisite like multiple employments, concurrent employments, global assignment etc. This could be considered as "An Addition" for Customization. 

In my practice below to display French version of Division, Department and Job Classification in Spotlight and Full Profile Header. In general, we need to create an Employment Differentiator object in Manage Data. An Employment Differentiator allow maximum 3 custom fields by design. We can leverage these 3 custom fields to link to standard or custom fields from Job Information Model HRIS Elements (ONLY). Then, the values (picklist configured for HRIS elements) can be displayed accordingly by this Employment Differentiator. Here comes the key configuration steps: 

Step 1 - Create Picklist for "JobClass_FR", "Division_FR", and "Dept_FR" respectively. Set these 3 picklist values directly as the French version of translation (These can be fetched from Manage Position). 

Step 2 - In Business Configuration, create custom-string for "Division FR", "Dept FR" and "Job Class FR" and set the picklist we configuration in Step 1 to the object respectively. 

Step 3 - Set Permission Roles for the custom-strings created in Step 2 for both System Admin and Employee Self Service. The proper role settings make sure both New Hire and Existing Employee will not miss to select the value defined in picklist as mandatory. 

This is important to remember that If the value used for the differentiator is not available in the current Job Information record, the value will not be displayed in People Profile.

Step 4 - To adopt Employment Differentiator, assignmentDisplayHeader should be enabled in Business Configuration -> Employee Profile -> Standard. 

In addition, please make sure RBP settings are configured for both System Admin and Employee Self Service to View/Edit Employee Data -> Employee Profile -> ASSIGNMENTDISPLAYHEADER.

Step 5 - Set up the Employment Differentiator object to connect the dots. It is named "Org Job FR" in my practice and its 3 custom fields point to the 3 custom-string created in Step 2. Jobinfo is only the supported HRIS element reference by design.

Step 6 - To Switch ON the Employment Differentiator, go to Configuration Latest People Profile -> General Settings -> Choose the Name created in Step 5 from the dropdown list of Choose Employment Differentiator.  Click the Save button.

Do not forget to Refresh Assignment Header and Refresh General Display Name from the Company System and Logo Settings to activate it.  After both HRIS Sync jobs are Completed from Scheduled Job Monitoring, it's time to check the final result. 

Step 7 - Final Check. The French Version can be displayed on header no matter which language setting is selected. 

Last but not least, Employment Differentiator could be used not only for translation workaround, but for dispalying any additional job information as well.

More details could be referred in the following SAP Help link. 

Adding Employment Differentiators To Indicate Multiple Employments

2786331 - Employee Central - Employment Differentiators Indicator

Thanks for your reading and hope this blog is helpful!

entry.title: Re: calculating depreciatio in SAP SAC Advance formula
entry.content:
Hi @Chanti 

Based on your requirement, I created the Advanced formulas script. Please check and apply it to your model. 

Model: Asset Dimension

  • Useful Life: Decimal Type
  • Start Date: Text Type
  • End Date: Test Type

Depreciation Calculating Script

MEMBERSET [d/Measures] = "Amount"
MEMBERSET [d/Asset] = ("Asset_01", "Asset_02", "Asset_03")
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/Start] TO [d/Version].[p/End]

FLOAT @Useful_Life
FLOAT @Start_Depreciation
FLOAT @End_Depreciation

//To aggregate Total Cost of each asset, Define Variable member and aggregate Cost value of Budget period.
VARIABLEMEMBER #Tatal_Cost OF [d/Account]
DATA([d/Account] = #Tatal_Cost, [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/Start]) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "Cost")

FOREACH [d/Asset]
	//Conversion each attribute value of asset to Numeric value 
	@Useful_Life = ATTRIBUTE([d/Asset].[p/Useful_Life]) * 12
	@Start_Depreciation = YEAR([d/Asset].[p/End_Date]) * 12 + MONTH([d/Asset].[p/End_Date]) + 1
	@End_Depreciation = YEAR([d/Asset].[p/End_Date]) * 12 + MONTH([d/Asset].[p/End_Date]) + 1 + @Useful_Life
	
    //Compare the budget version period with the asset’s depreciation period, 
	//and record the depreciation expense for the portion of the depreciation period that falls within the budget period.
	IF(YEAR([d/Date]) * 12 + MONTH([d/Date])) >= @Start_Depreciation AND (YEAR([d/Date]) * 12 + MONTH([d/Date])) < @End_Depreciation THEN
		DATA([d/Account] = "Depreciation") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = #Tatal_Cost, [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/Start]) / @Useful_Life
	ENDIF
ENDFOR

 

Example: Source data 

Example: Calculated Result

  • Asset3
    • Total cost =  2400
    • Useful life = 12 Month(1 Year)
    • Depreciation Start Period = 2025.Jul (Asset End date: 2025.Jun)
    • Depreciation End Period = 2026.Jun (12 Months)
    • Depreciation Exp: 200 (2400 / 12)

 

I hope this is helpful to you, and if I have misunderstood anything, please feel free to reach out.

Moonjun

entry.title: Types of ATC Errors in CDS views
entry.content:
While working with core data services (CDS) views in SAP, developers have to ensure performance, quality and stability .  So for this purpose  ATC is a major tool which can help to ensure identifying those potential issues in cds views because of which performance may decline.  So in this blog post am going to share my knowledge regarding these ATC error which can decrease performance of our Application. 

Some of the Types of ATC Error in cds views: 

Empty result Set 

This error indicates that cds views which is built on any table or other views are not able to fetch the data and returning empty dataset i.e. no data in CDS views. This can be happened because of faulty join condition, Association, wrong filters, or base view or table doesn’t have data which may leads to Empty dataset at Runtime. 

Fix: proper join condition, association condition should be appropriate, correct filter condition. 

Non-Unique Key 

This is one of the common error which may occur because of missing key fields in the cds views or base view have some duplicate data. wrong key combination can also leads to this error or incomplete key definition. 

      ATC is used to Highlights performance bottlenecks such as: 

  • Deeply nested cds views. 
  • Too many of Association which may leads to be expensive join. 
  • Projecting all fields instead of required fields  

Fix:  So in case one have to define all key fields to identify values uniquely. Also sometimes we need to mention additional keys as key fields to resolve this issue. 

Cyclic joins 

A cyclic joins error may cause multiple loop between cds views or entities, which leads to runtime error . 

Fix: So we have to design cds views in such a way it will remove cyclic condition and make it simple data model. 

Runtime KPI Violation 

This ATC error is happened most likely because of memory consumption, response time  

Or load on database. There is a threshold limit for every cds views. If cds views is breaching these threshold value to fech data in that time it will return this kind of error. 

Fix: Need to Analyse plan visualizer file(plv) file, reduce complexity, apply some filters to minimize load on database 

Insufficient Test Data 

In some cases there is less no. of records is present in the cds views which is not matching their expected value which is defined for every cds views. So  one have to check whether there is sufficient no. Of records is present or not in the cds views. 

Fix: Cds views should have minimum expected records available in a test system or need to maintain no. Of records which is less than expected records. 

Conclusion: 

By Fixing these ATC error in cds views, developers can ensure: 

  • Simple data model and accurate output. 
  • Better performance of application at Runtime. 
  • Easier maintainability.

entry.title: Re: PO public cloud - How can we detect delivery errors (...
entry.content:
Hello @AN23 

In the SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the Monitor Email Transmissions app shows only the status of emails sent from SAP even if the recipient's mailbox is invalid or the message bounces. The app status may display Succeeded because it tracks outbound transmission from SAP but not actual delivery to the supplier.

Here are some limitations and points to note

SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud does not provide native delivery or read receipt notifications integrated into its standard output management or monitor app.

The outbound status means the message left the SAP system. However, delivery failures at the recipient side in a situation where the email addresses are invalid are not tracked back into the system. So not delivered email will not be reflected in SAP.

Here are recommendations on how you can workaround that scenario

First thing to consider is to regularly audit and update supplier contact information to minimize invalid addresses.

If your organization requires confirmation of delivery, consider routing outbound emails through a middleware, SAP Integration Suite or a managed email gateway can surely be of help here. These options can process bounces and delivery errors and potentially report those back into SAP or via separate notifications.

Check if your email infrastructure or IT team can set up external monitoring or bounce-tracking for these transmissions but this solution would have to be outside SAP standard capabilities.

Monitor Email Transmissions

The summary is that SAP Public Cloud currently does not map external mailbox non-delivery errors back to Purchase Order or monitor apps. It is important to note that a middleware or external mail monitoring is required to address this challenge.

I hope this provides the desired result. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Exploring the RISE with SAP Methodology: Your Guiding Framework for Transformation - AM
entry.content: In this session, you will learn how RISE with SAP Methodology can help you on your journey to the cloud, and supports you in adopting clean core principles, making it easier to benefit from latest innovations to be ready for the challenges of today and tomorrow. RISE with SAP Methodology is a comprehensive framework, includes expert guidance from SAP and our partners, and includes tools and services to guide you on your transformation journey. The session covers a high level overview of the mission, key components, integrated toolchain for transformation.
